original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields down, rupee stronger
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields closed down on Wednesday following a fully subscribed bill auction, dealers said.
The rupee closed at 317/319 rupees to the US dollar in the spot market after opening at 313/323 rupees and deals done from around 320 to 318 to the US dollar, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 closed at 29.95/30.00 percent on Wednesday, down from 31.40/70 percent on Tuesday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 26.10/25 percent, down from 28.00/30 percent. (Colombo/Mar 08/2023)
